meanings.definition: Having or covered with prickles or thorns.
meanings.sent1: The cactus was pricklier than the soft pillow.
meanings.sent2: The rose bush is pricklier than the daisy.
meanings.sent3: Be careful not to touch the pricklier side of the hedgehog!
meanings.sent4: Her words were pricklier than a bed of thorns.
meanings.sent5: The thistle was pricklier than a porcupine.

meanings.sent1: His pricklier attitude made it hard to have a conversation.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise was pricklier than a mosquito bite.
meanings.sent3: She found his jokes more pricklier than funny.
meanings.sent4: The situation grew pricklier with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was pricklier than nails on a chalkboard.

meanings.sent1: The advanced math problem was pricklier than the ones before.
meanings.sent2: Running a marathon is pricklier than a short sprint.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all those tasks was pricklier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation became pricklier as the stakes rose.
meanings.sent5: Learning a new language can be pricklier than anticipated.
